Share a cleaning tip.
A cleaning tip is too first vacuum the downstairs room by room and then move elsewhere.
Share a cleaning tip.
To get rid of dishwasher odor, drop in a cut-up lemon, some salt, and a few ice cubes. The lemon deodorizes, and the ice and salt clean away residue.
Share a cleaning tip.
Put a drop of Dawn in a pint of water and use this to wipe your counters to discourage ants from crawling on them.
Share a cleaning tip.
When you vacuum, be sure to run items over a minimum of five times before attempting to pick it up.  This prevents too many incidents of bending over needlessly.
Share a cleaning tip.
A good idea for cleaning is to start in one space of your home and get that area COMPLETELY CLEAN and organized before moving onto another area. That way, you won't get overwhelmed!

Tell me about a place you visited.

I have visited Amsterdam, which is a city in the Netherlands.  I really enjoyed doing all of the touristy stuff there.  One of the highlights of my visit was being able to see the red light district.  Prostitution is legal in the Netherlands, and there was a really interesting street that was very narrow, and got narrower as you walked down it, and it had doors that led to small rooms with just a bed, and each room had a window where the girls would stand and beckon men to come inside and have sex with them.  That whole area of town had many businesses whose focus was sex.  There were live sex theaters and many shops that had sex toys for sale.  Another place we saw during our visit was the Heineken brewery.  That was very interesting.  And, we went to a couple of "coffee" shops.  In reality, these coffee shops were places where people would go to smoke marijuana or hashish.  This activity is also legal in the Netherlands.

Tell me a feel-good story you heard recently.

My dog Otis knows how to count.  He loves to pick up pine cones in his mouth.  We went for a walk the other day, and I kicked a pine cone.  He ran and picked it up.  I said "Otis you have one pine cone."  We walked a little further and I kicked another one.  Natural, being a labrador, he ran and got it. "Otis, you have two pine cones. "  He had both in his mouth.  A few minutes later he came back with a third in his mouth.  "Otis?  Do you have three?"  Our walk ended.  We played this game a few times. One day I went out and said, "Otis get me one pine cone." Sure enough he came back with one.  Then I told him to get two.  Sure enough he came back with two pine cones in his mouth.  He also passed the test for three pine cones.  But I could never get him to get four.  It seemed like his brain could only count to three.  Any more than that he would just bring back however many would fit in his mouth.  We called that number "fourses and fives", which meant anything over three.

I really like I live in a place where you are supposed to be ready for an earthquake at any time.

I read an article a few weeks ago recommending that everybody should have an emergency kit and an evacuation plan in case of any emergency that might come up, and it makes sense, but disasters seem like such remote possibilities that it's hard to feel any sense of urgency.

I've only been in one earthquake, it was pretty minor and I was only in a four-story building at work -- at first when I noticed the floor shaking I thought that somebody must be hopping down the aisle between the cubicles, and it took me a minute to realize that didn't make any sense and to mentally process that we were having an earthquake.
That's why I'm hoping to be able to go to space one day -- you just can't trust the earth to not quake on you.
Preparing for a disaster when it's not happening tends to feel silly, but it's probably the right thing to do.

But you know, IT companies aren't the only groups that want to try and control everything. The government isn't that much better, what with the NSA spying and all that. It's hard to know who we can trust now days. I mostly just trust family and friends.
Soon they'll have more powerful than the government, that is, unless of course the government had them install backdoors into everything and they're listening in, too.

The IT companies want to gather information about everything about us. What we like, what we dislike, how many friends we have, and so on. Then they can sell that information to other companies and advertisers. Everyone will have to rely on them to get what they need. After all, information is power, and he who controls information is a powerful man indeed.

Think about it! They'll know all the times know all the kinds of porn we like, and when we like to watch it! They'll bombard us with popups and trick us into watching it constantly; getting us hooked on new perversions! Then no one will ever go outside, so no one will be able to stop them! It's the perfect plan, isn't it? As long as they their systems don't hook them, too.
So be careful out there. You wouldn't want to get hurt. If you did, you'd have to go to the hospital, and it seems like insurance costs are rising sky high lately.
Oh, and your breaks. Never know when something could go wrong with those. Actually, it's a good idea to get your whole car checked out, and the locks on your doors too.

I mean, the world is a dangerous place, you never know who's out to get you, or how they'll do it. It never hurts to be cautious. It never hurts to be prepared even if 99% of the time everything is just fine. Gotta stay safe, man.

Break open your condoms to make sure there are no microchips in there. Those things will collect your sperm and upload them to the internet to create a race of anatomically correct super digital clone men! I mean, they won't do much, 'cause they'll be stuck online, but it'll be weird.

I guess it doesn't matter. Those things don't work half the time anyway, so they probably aren't listening. You know what else never seems to work half the time? Cellphones these days. Seems like every one I get breaks on me. What kind of phone do you use?
As long as you're friend isn't threatening their companies, or society or whatever, I think it'll be alright.  That's assuming they're even listening at all. He's probably just being paranoid.

You don't think he's threatening anyone, or plotting a bombing or anything like that right? I guess the NSA or FBI or whoever might be scared of that, even if you're joking. Or if he's talking about switching toa different company or system, or something. Yeah, that sort of thing might make the manufacturer nervous as well.

Unless he's got a bunch of middle school kids tied up in his basement that are screaming to get out, I don't think he has much to worry about. And even if he does, their screams will be so muffled by the time they get to the listening devices, they probably won't even hear!
It seems like this is the way things are going, though. Maybe in a few years it will be like cell phones and it will seem weird to NOT have them.

I mean obviously they ARE listening, because otherwise how would they know that you're talking to them? But they're supposed to just ignore it unless it's relevant to what they're programmed to respond to.

It's probably no big deal. But then you hear about how the NSA just has a giant database of intercepted conversations and you start to wonder whether they'd be able to collect what these things hear, too, you know?
It would be convenient for when I need the pod bay doors opened.
Do you wanna get a pizza?
I prefer the paper. You can form a better opinion when you're reading it alone.
I can't stand the news on the television. I do not like news anchors.
Yeah, news people are boring.
Anyway, I don't read the newspaper much. I prefer to read books instead. Sci-fi novels and non-fiction mostly. Are there any specific kinds of books you read?
The ink is all runny, and you can't even tell what the pictures are of anymore. How am I supposed to enjoy reading a bunch of smudgy blobs?

Though, if I'm being honest, even when it's not wet outside the newspaper isn't my favorite way to read about the news. It's great for local stuff, but everything else you could read online as the story develops. News in newspapers is usually a bit dated, and the news you can get online is free.

Still, it's better than watching those late night talk shows where they go, "Did you hear about this? The president is a moron. He did a really stupid thing today. Gave away classified information, because he's so dumb. That's the joke. He's an idiot. And I'm explaining it because he's so stupid, he wouldn't understand it otherwise!", you know? So original. What a great way to get your news.
Oh well, I guess industries die and start up all the time. Who knows where they'll end up. If you could end up working in a different industry, what would you like to be doing?
All those jobs lost. I wonder where all the reporters and newspaper editors will end up. Maybe they'll have to get jobs in TV too?

Of course, it's not just newspapers. The entire paper industry is dying. It's been going for years, little by little. No one wants to read paper books when they can get them electronically on their tablets. And no one wants to buy newspapers when they can read news on Facebook for free. The death of these industries is inevitable.

With all those leftover, unsold newspapers, I'll be able to build myself a paper house, paper clothes, and a giant bonfire to keep myself warm. I'll be set for life! I'll be like a superhero; Paperman. My power is that I selfishly hoard old newspapers and use them for mundane tasks!

Personally, I have no problem with getting your news with a dose of entertainment, but I prefer to get my news from Vloggers instead. Their opinions seem more real to me. I just feel like I'm able to relate to them somehow, you know?
It's all about having someone regurgitate the day's topics that everyone who has already glanced at trending news section anywhere on the internet has already heard.

No one seems to care about humor, or celebrities anymore. It's not about watching interesting interviews, or hearing neat little anecdotes. People just want to dose off while feeling like they're informed about stuff.

I mean, I could watch a serious, in-depth program about the news like Frontline for free on PBS, or I could watch highlights from last night's monologue by Jimmy "Everyone In Late Night TV Is Named Jimmy" Bland-Middle-America so I have something to talk about with my coworkers over lunch so I can feel like I'm in the know about things! Look at me! I'm smart and topical! Hurhurhur!
It's not even good humor. If you want to see real humor, I suggest going to the movies. Have you seen any good comedies lately?
I understand that people like their comedy to be topical, but I think it's too much. What ever happened to absurdist stylings? Or just being funny to be funny?

People want to laugh, but they also want to feel smart. They want to feel like they're learning, and being informed. So they kill two birds with one stone, even if most of these late night TV shows aren't good examples of news or humor.

Maybe this is just the start. Maybe everything will be a joke? Maybe we'll wake up one day and find out that the president has ordered a nuclear first strike 'cause he thought it was funny. At least the late night comedians would be out of a job then. Not just because everything would be one big joke, but 'cause, you know... They'd be dead.

You would think manufacturing would provide most of the driving power behind the economy. But I guess those jobs are leaving due to automation. Robots really are the future. Maybe we'll even see people getting robot pets, or marrying robots, huh?
They go to a few stores, stay in a few hotels, eat a few restaurants, and bam, somehow they're the driving force behind the entire economy.

It's crazy to think that a bunch of people who don't even live in the area, who may not even speak the language, somehow provide for everyone who lives there. Without these visitors, who will never stay for long, and truly appreciate the way of life for the people who live there, everything would go belly-up and the locals would have to move.

Tourists really do have all the power since they run the whole economy. They ought to demand ought to demand the royal treatment! "Bring me your best wine and virgins, for I am your new god for the next two weeks, and a couple hours before I have to leave for the airport!"

But speaking of getting away to places, I've been meaning to get down to the store and buy some new clothes. I've been wearing the same stuff for years, and it's time I got something new. What do you think I should get? IS there anything particular in style right now?
You get to go somewhere else, be someone else, and just enjoy yourself. It's the greatest feeling in the world.
Everyone needs a break from the stresses and monotony of everyday life. When you travel, for a brief moment you can push worries of your life away pretend you have no responsibilities.

It's like being an angel! Or in my case, a demon, since when I travel I always get my fun from going around and sabotaging everyone else's enjoyment and just being a huge ass! I actually have a devil I wear and everything. We should vacation together, I'll show you.
I can't even tell you all the amazing places I've visited. Some of them aren't even real. I've been into VR lately, and using it to visit virtual destinations. Have you tried VR yet?
I love going to new places, seeing new people, trying new foods. The entire experience is what makes life worth living. I don't know how I'd get by without travel.

It's always been my lifelong goal to travel the world. It's basically my biggest aspiration. To travel to every continent, excluding Antarctica of course. I want to visit all the major cities in the world, and lots of small hidden locations too. I guess I just want to see it all, and experience everything.

The moment I get too old to travel I will literally die then and there. I will just fall over dead, so that I can travel to my next and final destination. I wonder where I'll end up. Guess I'll still have one surprise to look forward to!

I think I would like living in Italy the most.  The food, the history, and the people are all so interesting to me.

Would you rather be rich and alone or be poor and find true love?

I would rather be poor and find true love. Being poor is a situation I can overcome. I might not ever become rich, but I would have the things that really count in life: True love, caring, dedication, devotion, companionship. My husband and I would be able to find ways to survive financially. It might not be easy but it would be worth it. 

Being rich and alone would  be harder. You would begin to hate people because you would realize that people don't truly care for you, only what you can give them or do for them. 

There is a chance that being poor and having your true love wouldn't work out either. A lot of couples, who truly love each other, fight and break up over money issues. Lack of money to take care of one's loved ones can change a person's personality. How many horror stories have been on the news about a spouse that committed domestic violence, or even murder and it is said about that person that they used to be a wonderful person until losing their job or financial troubles began and they started drinking or doing drugs. 

Human beings need love and companionship. Now that is not to say I wouldn't prefer being Rich and having my True love together. We would be able to accomplish so much more in life and help others.

I would rather be poor and find true love because companionship is more important to me than any monetary value.

What defines a sport? Is fishing a sport? How about video game tournaments?

I'm not sure what defines a sport. I believe fishing is a sport because it's competitive but I'm not sure a sport needs to be competitive to be considered a sport. Fishing is more physical than most people would expect. Video game tournaments are definitely sporting events, people are competing with their skill, knowledge, strategy, and hand-eye coordination-- it may not be an easy concept for people who grew up on Pac-Man to accept but video games have all the elements of a sport.

I think a sport should involve physical activity. I do not consider fishing or video game tournaments to be sports. They can still be worthwhile endeavors and competitions, but are just not sports in my mind.

My children are such beacons of encouragement and such a source of challenge that propels me to pursue and become the best of me. Having children surrounds you with so much truth. It is inevitable that you face your demons and become better for it. They have taught me more gratitude than I have ever known.

What was the best time period of your life? What do you think will be the best time period of your entire life?

The best period of my life is actually right now. Being a new mom, I'm rediscovering who I am and enjoying every moment of baby snuggles. I have this picture of the future in my head of the best period of my life. In it, I have more than just the one child, I've raised them successfully and I'm sitting next to my husband, holding his hand, on the back porch of a house we built together, watching our children play with our grandkids. My husband will be the same man that I am married to now.
What was the best time period of your life? What do you think will be the best time period of your entire life?

Well, so far, I think the best time period of my life is now. I have two older, established children and two younger, still very needy and cuddle, babies. I am more confident in my body and in my self than I have ever been. I am more assertive, I take less shit, and I care more deeply about those around me. I am really looking forward to the next few decades. I am really hoping that my retirement years are the best of my life. I want to enjoy life.

What do you think about the organic food movement?

It took a while for us to be a part of the organic food movement, but we are finally there. It is an inevitable step in this information age. We are processing and being approached with new information every day. Reflecting on things that we have pursued and the repercussions. Its great that people are asking questions and there are options and they are becoming more and more reasonable and accessible every day.

What do you think about the organic food movement?

I am torn on this one. I think the certified organic movement is a crock. It is expense and cost prohibitive for most small farmers. There are an awful lot of hoops to jump through to attaint that label. Another issue I have is that people associate organic with no pesticide use and that is not the case. Big organic farms still use pesticides and practices that are not necessarily best for the environment. Pesticides that kill thousands of pollinators such as honey bees annually. I do think that people are paying more attention to what they are eating and starting to bring their business to their local farmer.

Everybody stared at us everywhere we went, since we were the only foreigners around, which was very uncomfortable. On top of that, it was just very heartbreaking to see the way people lived there. What apps have changed your life a lot?

What apps have changed your life a lot?

Some apps that have changed my life a lot are my Walmart Grocery App and my Apple Health App. The Walmart Grocery App allows me to add groceries to my cart as I realize something needs replaced, then once I'm ready to buy my groceries I just check out and schedule a time to pick up! It's amazing! The Apple Health app keeps track of my exercise, I am able to track my steps, how many miles I have walked/ran, and if I did any flights of stairs or not!
What apps have changed your life a lot?

Scanable is the first one that comes to mind. Last year we about a house and along with that come a ton of paperwork, copies that need to be sent, things that need signed and sent again. Have you ever saved an animals life? How about a persons life?

Once my dad and I were fishing in our rubber raft and a woman and her husband tipped over their canoe. The woman was wearing a heavy coat, cowboy boots and could not swim. Her husband was trying to save her and himself but he was weighed down by his own clothing and boots. I quickly untied our boat and my dad rowed as fast as he could. Luckily I was able to hang over the boat and reach as far as I could down into the water and reach the womans hair. We rowed them to shore and they were both saved. This was very hard for a 10 year old.
Have you ever saved an animals life? How about a persons life?

I haven't ever saved an animals life, nor a humans life. However, in the moment, I thought I did save a humans life. I was leaving work at night and traveling on the West Seattle bridge. It was empty. I was driving westbound and a car on the other side was traveling eastbound. All of a sudden it started doing barrel rolls and landed right side up right next to the little cement barriers that divide the highway you know? I had came to a screeching halt, ran out and took their pulse. Called 911. Waited with them. A taxi of guys coming back from the bar also pulled over and started praying around the person. It was crazy. They barely had a pulse and weren't using a seatbelt, because they were upside down in the drivers seat. I got a call from the offer closing the investigation like a year later telling me they passed away. It was really sad. I'll never forget that moment. I wish I could've done more.
Have you ever saved an animals life? How about a persons life?

We save animals all the time...they don't call us black sheep farms for nothing!  I recently took in my cousin and her two cats.  The cousin was being abused by her boyfriend and the cats were sick and malnourished.  The cats required some vet visits, but they're both doing great now.  My cousin is learning to stand on her own two feet again, but some days it's like having another kid.

What do you think of online education?

As a 61-year-old, I find the concept of online education fascinating.  except for a very short free on-line course I took a few years ago, I have no experience in it.  When I went to college in the mid to late 1970s, I could never imagine a person getting educated on-line.  I would have thought that would be something that wouldn't happen for, maybe, another century.  I think it's wonderful that people can organize their life around their education; take courses from the comfort of their own home.  However, and perhaps it's because of my age, I think there's something lacking in it...I think it's more interesting when people are in the same room exchanging ideas.  I know about chat rooms but it's not the same as being physically in the same place as others.  So I think online education is good, but certainly not ideal.

What is the deal with fidget spinners?

Fidget spinners have really burst out this year, and it's basically a way to keep ADHD kids or kids with short attention spans focused in class or while doing work. Teachers, however, hate the latest invention and are starting to ban it from classrooms. There's a debate on whether the product actually works or is helpful or not. Some people are outraged that teachers are banning something like this from their classrooms while others feel that the spinners actually distract the students even more, as well as keeping the "normal" kids from focusing as well.

Would you rather be rich and alone or be poor and find true love?

I would rather be poor and find true love. Being poor is a situation I can overcome. I might not ever become rich, but I would have the things that really count in life: True love, caring, dedication, devotion, companionship. My husband and I would be able to find ways to survive financially. It might not be easy but it would be worth it. 

Being rich and alone would  be harder. You would begin to hate people because you would realize that people don't truly care for you, only what you can give them or do for them. 

There is a chance that being poor and having your true love wouldn't work out either. A lot of couples, who truly love each other, fight and break up over money issues. Lack of money to take care of one's loved ones can change a person's personality. How many horror stories have been on the news about a spouse that committed domestic violence, or even murder and it is said about that person that they used to be a wonderful person until losing their job or financial troubles began and they started drinking or doing drugs. 

Human beings need love and companionship. Now that is not to say I wouldn't prefer being Rich and having my True love together. We would be able to accomplish so much more in life and help others.

I would rather be poor and find true love because companionship is more important to me than any monetary value.

I have severe social anxiety and agoraphobia which makes it rather difficult for me to do various tasks that others take for granted. I can't even travel to a Walmart parking lot without having a panic attack. I've been working on it for years, and have made some progress, but not enough for me to live a normal, routine life. Where do you spend most of your free time / day?

Being a stay at home mom to a new baby, I rarely have free time. There's house work, doctor's appointments, child development classes, keeping the baby entertained, helping the baby reach all of his milestones,  trying to do some surveys and Mturk work to earn a little extra petty cash while fighting to keep the baby who suddenly woke up from a dead sleep from eating the device I'm using, comfort feeding a growing, teething baby in the middle of a leap, fighting the urge to rearrange everything and paint the house because you're going stir crazy,  and fending off visitors who just want to criticize everything you're doing. When my husband comes home and takes over baby play time,  I finally get a break from all of that, I like to just sit and relax with my cats.
